verses.roman:
mumucuḥ puṣpa-varṣāṇi
hate pāpe vṛkāsure
devarṣi-pitṛ-gandharvā
mocitaḥ saṅkaṭāc chivaḥ

synonyms: mumucuḥ—they released; puṣpa—of flowers; varṣāṇi—rain; hate—having been killed; pāpe—the sinful; vṛka-asure—demon Vṛka; deva-ṛṣi—the celestial sages; pitṛ—departed forefathers; gandharvāḥ—and singers of heaven; mocitaḥ—freed; saṅkaṭāt—from danger; śivaḥ—Lord Śiva.
translation: The celestial sages, Pitās and Gandharvas rained down flowers to celebrate the killing of sinful Vṛkāsura. Now Lord Śiva was out of danger.
